news_header: Mayor Timo Koivisto's budget proposal for Jyväskylä includes significant cuts and some investments, with a projected deficit of €20.7 million for the next year.
news_text: In his budget proposal, Mayor Timo Koivisto outlines severe cuts, including the closure of several schools and community activities, resulting in an estimated deficit of €20.7 million for the upcoming year. The budget also includes investments totaling approximately €85 million, with funds allocated for daycare centers, theater, and various community projects. Notably, the Hippos project costs will be deferred to 2026 and 2027. The income and property tax rates will remain unchanged. Various political groups have expressed concerns over the proposed cuts, particularly in culture and education. The City Council will discuss the proposal before a final decision is made on November 25.
